title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
Was liquid. Was cleaned, repaired backlight.

I now have fast fans  and it doesn't recognise any ssd (tested with known good ones) 
I really dont know where to look. SSD gets power.ect, entire circuit looks fine, no components ripped off/corroded.

Also oddly enough i cant get it to boot selection or diagnostics. Im starting to suspect the SMC, reflowing it however has made no difference. 
Checked the entire board for clues under a microscope and couldnt see anything abnormal.

I really dont know where to start.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Can you boot internal diagnostics from USB? If it doesn't get to the question mark how do you know it is not recognizing the SSD?

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
Hi.
I cannot get to boot selection via the alt key, and the D key does not respond when it powers on. I have not yet tried with a USB keyboard as the internal components are known good parts. 

It gets to question mark, i have managed to boot it to an installer but it was running slow.
So obviously there is a sensor error (probably temperature).

I will have a bit more of a fiddle when im next in the workshop

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Remove SSD and boot ASD from USB and check for errors.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: What ASD supports 2015 airs? cant seem to find one

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Oh yeah no ASD for these. Boot internal diagnostic by holding down D.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: yep and it will say, oops theres a problem, take me to an apple store. take it to an apple store, we cant fix it need to replace logic board

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Thought i was right on that. Yeah ill try getting it to diagnosis but last time it was having none of it! :/

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
got it to run diagnosis. It seems in EFI the trackpads not working (sometimes i can get a bit of vertical movement), But im sure it worked in a 10.12 installer
Said there was also an issue with SSD storage but thats to be expected.

Ive started inspecting the tpad_SPI lines.ect but i can confirm this is a good trackpad and is 100% a board fault.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: i said something replying to the email, is not relevant now

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Might be a dumb question, but have you made sure you're testing the board in a 2013-2015 casing and not a 2012 casing? The trackpads and KB/TP cables are not compatible across 2012 and 2013-15. This wouldn't affect the SSD issue, however, but it could explain some of the other issues.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
Yes im sure its in a good casing... the correct year.ect

I reflashed the EFI on the motherboard, it kept failing to erase the chip at a certain address. So i ended up fitting a different chip and reprogramming it (with a clean ME Region) 

It didnt make a bit of difference though.
This board is driving me mad.

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
Need to know some stuff for sure. 
Does the trackpad/keyboard work in the boot menu?
Does the trackpad/keyboard work when booted from USB into OSX?

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message:
Right
Keyboard only occasionally works in boot menu
Trackpad Jumpy as hell in boot menu

Keyboard and trackpad work in OSX perfectly. 

Since installing an SSD and re-running diagnosis it just gives the generic 'there may be a problem with your SMC'

title: 820-00164 (Fast fan, No SSD detected)
message: Only thing I can say is checking all pins of trackpad connector for continuity to the trackpad, check all voltages and also on diode mode.
